Personal Rating 7/10

I think I will always be at war with this game. Therefore, I personally have a hard time recommending this game. And I've been with it since almost the beginning (2017).

The idea is innoative and unchallenged on the market. So it is simply something new. Great to play with friends.
DBD has a high learning curve, so it actually takes many hundreds of hours actually until you can claim you are somewhere good XD.
Many also have different perceptions of being "good" in the game. Which is based primarily on logical decisions. So use your brain

Best, be productive and always make gens when someone is being chased.

Nevertheless, many problems are present. The game has a very toxic community! The developers take a very very long time to fix bugs. It is a classic that with updates more bugs are created than solved or some are not solved even after 5 years. This also applies to gameplay implementations and new ideas in general. Personally, I think the developers are a bit unprofessional in dealing with their own game, especially in terms of  understanding.  You should listen more to the community and veterans.

After 300+ hours of wasted time let me save you some. The game is horridly unbalanced with things such as noed morris and god loops. It may be a survivor sided game but with matchmaking being the worst I've ever seen it after multiple different reworks I can't even have fun in a game that I consider one of the most casual. You can be a rank 1 survivor (best rank) and get 3 rank 20 (worst Rank) survivors on your side against a rank 1 killer. This game has no "ranked" or "casual" mode as it is integrated into every game and the devs still can't figure out how to fix the matchmaking after 4 years. A game that I really enjoy and want to succeed has just simply failed. The game is simply unplayable unless they can fix their matchmaking. Someone who's playing their first game ever can be matched with people with thousands of hours. In a game that relies so heavily on teamwork and individual skill it simply doesn't have the matchmaking which is the most critical element in any multiplayer game. Considering most free to play games and big titles can get this simple but crucial element working properly in their games on launch and that this company has had 4 years to do so and still fails as I type this, don't waste your money on it. DBD can cost 1 cent and I wouldn't even waste that on it. Personally I've already put the money and time into this game so I can't quit morally because of it being a complete waste of money at that point but simply put, don't make the same mistake I did. Do not buy this game.
Really fun to play with friends.

Never buy this game. Brain dead developers that are too prideful to actually fix anything. Bugs exist in the game for months. Survivors are clearly the favorite as they make up the majority of the player base. The community is 100% toxic, whenever you outplay someone they ask for your address so they can "ruin" you. Fun is actively avoided by all involved in the game. The central game play of the game is running around a piece of wood that a survivor will drop on your dumb face and then blind you with a flashlight while tea bagging you without end. 
Developers are 100% okay with hackers as without video proof you have zero chance of getting any action taken. Even then, they might not act on it because it's probably just a developer hacking anyway since they live in the "Grade" Ash 4 or whatever it's called now.

Run from this game at all cost and wait for a better developer with more experience making games buys DBD. Join everyone on the sidelines and pray for this games demise from bad product deals and stagnation.
Blizzard's balancing team + EA's marketing = Behavior

This game will leave you either spending all your time in a lobby or spamming your space bar for hours at a time. Unless you're getting this game for free, it is not worth playing. And even then, I wouldn't waste the hard drive space.
